ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Close reading of films, fine art, and academic literature

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: stellar screening list (almost every screening was available for streaming, too, which is a rare achievement), manageable reading load, solid in-class discussion Weaknesses: not enough time applying the readings to the screenings

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Brigitte is very generous with her time and feedback on student thoughts. Both instructors in the course would challenge student comments in constructive ways in order to push for more substantive conclusions during class discussions. The more tightly focused reading list meant that more thought and time could be given to the course because it never felt like I had to rush through materials in order to be prepared for seminar.
